intro: Strobilanthes ovatifolia, commonly known as the broad-leaf strobilanthes, is a herbaceous plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its ovate, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces striking clusters of tubular, two-lipped flowers that are typically purple or violet in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
